Question ten

We can simulate many realistic effects using computer graphics by incorporating simple physics in the model. Simulate a bouncing ball in two dimensions incorporating both gravity and elastic collisions with a surface. You can model the ball with a closed polygon that has a sufficient number of sides to look smooth.

BouncingBallSimulation Class

class BouncingBallSimulation

A class for simulating the motion of a bouncing ball using Pygame.

Variables:

  • width (int) – Width of the simulation canvas.

  • height (int) – Height of the simulation canvas.

  • ball_radius (int) – Radius of the bouncing ball.

  • position (list) – Current position of the ball as a tuple (x, y).

  • velocity (list) – Current velocity of the ball as a tuple (vx, vy).

  • gravity (float) – Acceleration due to gravity.

  • elasticity (float) – Coefficient of restitution for elastic collisions.

__init__(width, height, ball_radius, initial_position, initial_velocity, gravity, elasticity)

Initialize the bouncing ball simulation.

Parameters:

  • width (int) – Width of the simulation canvas.

  • height (int) – Height of the simulation canvas.

  • ball_radius (int) – Radius of the bouncing ball.

  • initial_position (tuple) – Initial position of the ball as a tuple (x, y).

  • initial_velocity (tuple) – Initial velocity of the ball as a tuple (vx, vy).

  • gravity (float) – Acceleration due to gravity.

  • elasticity (float) – Coefficient of restitution for elastic collisions.

update_position(time_step)

Update the position of the ball based on the current velocity and time step.

Parameters:

time_step (float) – Time step for the simulation.

handle_wall_collisions()

Check for collisions with the walls and update velocity accordingly.

simulate_bouncing_ball(num_frames, frame_duration, output_file=None)

Simulate the bouncing ball for a specified number of frames.

Parameters:

  • num_frames (int) – Number of frames to simulate.

  • frame_duration (int) – Duration of each frame in milliseconds.

  • output_file (str) – Output GIF file name (optional, None if not saving).

draw_frame()

Draw the current frame with the bouncing ball.

Returns:

pygame.Surface - Pygame Surface object representing the current frame.

calculate_ball_points()

Calculate the points of the ball polygon based on the current position and radius.

Returns:

list - List of tuples representing the points of the ball polygon.

handle_events()

Handle events such as quitting the simulation.

main()

Example usage:

# Example usage
width = 600
height = 400
ball_radius = 20
initial_position = (width // 2, height // 2)
initial_velocity = (100, 0)
gravity = 300
elasticity = 0.8
num_frames = 100

# Create and simulate bouncing ball
simulation = BouncingBallSimulation(width, height, ball_radius, initial_position, initial_velocity, gravity, elasticity)
simulation.simulate_bouncing_ball(num_frames, frame_duration=50)  # milliseconds
